title: Bibai
text:
is a <a href="Cities%20of%20Japan">city</a> located in <a href="Sorachi%20Subprefecture">Sorachi Subprefecture</a>, <a href="Hokkaido">Hokkaido</a>, <a href="Japan">Japan</a>.
As of 2013, the city has an estimated <a href="population">population</a> of 24,768, and the <a href="population%20density">density</a> of 89.2 persons per km2. The total area is 277.61 km2.
History.
The name "Bibai" is derived from Ainu word "pipa o i", meaning "Place (swamp) with many <a href="cockscomb%20pearl%20mussel">cockscomb pearl mussel</a>s".
At its peak, Bibai was a <a href="coal%20town">coal town</a> that produced over a million tons annually. However, ever since the mine was closed in 1972, the city has suffered a slowly declining population.
Geography.
<a href="Ishikari%20River">Ishikari River</a> flows to west of Bibai. <a href="Bibai%20Dam">Bibai Dam</a> was built on the Bibai River, a tributary of Ishikari River.
Lake Miyajima was registered as a wetland under the <a href="Ramsar%20Convention">Ramsar Convention</a> in 2002.
Transportation.
Rail.
Hakodate Main Line Minami-Bibai Branch Line used to run from Bibai to Minami-Bibai.
Road.
Straight line section of Route 12 is the longest in Japan.
